bach_open_taxonomy.ObjectivFrame.from_objectiv_data¶

classmethod ObjectivFrame.from_objectiv_data(db_url=None, start_date=None, end_date=None, time_aggregation='YYYY-MM-DD HH24:MI:SS.MS', table_name='data')[source]¶

Loads data from table into an ObjectivFrame object.

Parameters

  • db_url (Optional[str]) – the url that indicate database dialect and connection arguments. If not given, env DSN is used to create one. If that’s not there, the default of ‘postgresql://objectiv:@localhost:5432/objectiv’ will be used.

  • start_date – first date for which data is loaded to the DataFrame. If None, data is loaded from the first date in the sql table.

  • end_date – last date for which data is loaded to the DataFrame. If None, data is loaded up to and including the last date in the sql table.

  • time_aggregation (str) – sets the default time_aggregation that can be used with the time_aggregated property as a normal series. This means for example that the time_aggregated can be used as to group by. Ie. YYYY-MM-DD groups the time_aggregated property to days (dates). The default sets it to the date time on miliseconds.

  • table_name (str) – the name of the sql table where the data is stored.
